Reviews.Title: “A familly hotel for a lovely city”
Reviews.Author: Anatomyclass
Reviews.Content: I have to admit, I booked this little hotel for it's rate... But I will stay again and refer others because of it's location (within easy walking distance) from most major Istanbul sites. The kind and thorough attention we received from staff (my sister broke her ankle at the Hippodrone) and they went out of their way for her. Best part of all? Several wonderful restaurants that were fantastic respites for tired travelers and the kind neighbors... (if you're looking for a rug in Istanbul, just walk across the street...they had the finest and best priced rugs in Istanbul) plus? They ordered us dinner to be brought to the hotel when they heard my sister was injured that afternoon. That's more than kindness, that's family. I can't encourage you enough to stay Armagrandi Spina.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: pakdoc
Reviews.Content: Great location. Easy walk to all the great attractions (Blue Mosque, Hajia Sofia, Tokapi Palace, great restaurants, Grand Bazaar and public transport/tour buses. Reasonable room and service considering the price.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Place”
Reviews.Author: Jim and Annette S
Reviews.Content: Not only was the location perfect, the rooms amazing, and the traditional Turkish breakfast on the upstairs deck a great way to start the day....the best part of our five-day stay was the staff! We would whole heartedly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a very enjoyable time in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, family-friendly, great deal!”
Reviews.Author: American_Abroad_12
Reviews.Content: -First, you can't beat the location. We looked out our window at the Blue Mosque only a football field (American) away and couldn't believe it. It's a short walk to all the Sultanahmet sites, very good restaurants, shopping, you name it. -Second, this is a very family-friendly hotel. We're used to European and East Asian hotels that are stumped to find out a couple has more than one child. The staff is very friendly and we felt having children there was not a problem. Our kids loved the breakfast. -Third, the hotel staff is very responsive. Our requests were quickly and cheerfully met. -Finally, on complaints about noise. Sultanahmet is a busy section of a large city. Of course there's street noise at night. And the call to prayer is a fact of life when visiting a Muslim city. We didn't think the noise level was unusual at all.

Reviews.Title: “Oh the NOISE!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Daniel678
Reviews.Content: The noisiest hotel I've ever stayed in across 54 countries and 50 U.S. States. Concrete trucks, gravel haulers, various other road construction equipment, garbage trucks, city cleaners, tour buses, idling coaches, banging doors, tile hallways, and all this before prayer calls at 5:45 am. Breakfasts are very weak as well. Only strength is location right between the major sights in the old city. However, even this can be a curse as the whole area caters only to tourists so prices and food quality of nearby restaurants suffer. I've stayed in other parts of Istanbul for much less and gotten far greater value along with much less noise.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, thin walls at annex building”
Reviews.Author: sprintxoxo
Reviews.Content: If you are a light sleeper, do not accept a room at Armagrandi annex building next door from the main building, especially the room that shares a wall with the entrance door. We stayed twice at Armagrandi during our recent trip to Istanbul. The first stay was good in a quiet room in the main building and breakfast was excellent. For our second stay, we were given a room in the annex building where all sort of noise can be heard through the thin walls; private, rythmic movements that you do not wish to hear in a hotel, television sound from other floors at midnight. It was a nightmare! To the Hotel manager: it's only decent service to provide complimentary 2 water bottles daily when guests cannot drink the tap water. Other hotels in Turkey provide it, why can't you?

Reviews.Title: “Great base to explore Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: djdg1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is extremely close to all the main tourist attractions in this area. It is a short walk to the tram stop which links you to anywhere you may wish to visit further afield. The uninterrupted views of the blue mosque & hagia sophia from the roof terrace make this hotel something special. Our room was basic & a little small. However, there is so much to see & do nearby this was not our priority. There is a substantial buffet breakfast in the pleasant dining rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: fdeva
Reviews.Content: A lovely little quaint hotel in a prime location. There's lots of shops and restaurants on the same street and the Blue mosque is literally around the corner. The location is amazing! The hotel was perfect for us as we were only in Istanbul for a very short period. The hotel is nicely decorated and the rooms are not too small (but not that big either). We were offered a room on the ground floor which I was initially worried about, as I thought we'd hear the traffic/noise/people passing by but it was very quiet. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The room had an AC and heating (not that powerful but sufficent). The bathroom was a little small but clean. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was toast and cold dishes. I didn't expect anything more so I wasn't disappointed. Pro points: The hotel has free wifi which was brilliant and came in handy. If you go to the top of the hotel, you can step outside on to the balcony which has breathtaking views of the Blue Mosque. If you haven't got much luggage with you then it's worth booking the hotel's shuttle service to the airport. It's about 15 turkish lira each and it takes about 45 minutes to get to Ataturk airport. We'd defintely stay here again. It's a really nice hotel and the location is brilliant!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: mandy939
Reviews.Content: The location, as mentioned in prior posts, is PERFECT. Smack in between the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia with incredible views of both, and the Bosphorus from the rooftop bar. Which, I should mention is not really a bar, though they will serve you drinks (and maybe food?) more on that later. Rooms are small, but clean. Minibar was reasonable, nice to have a small fridge. We purchased most of our water (you canÂ´t drink it) and such at the many little groceries in the area to save cost. Breakfast was adequate, if repetitive. Eggs, sausage, yogurt, cheese, the usual, and rather good. We were there for three nights. I think had we been there longer we may have grown tired of it. Staff was nice. Internet computer downstairs is a nice perk. Very low prices for use. Istanbul information is free, and just .06TL per minute (about 3 Euros per hour). As mentioned, location was great. DonÂ´t spend all of your time on the main street in Sultanahmet, venture just a few blocks backwards, towards the water for very lively streets with bars, restaurants, etc. Also, reasonably priced convenience stores. The ONE problem I had was with the rooftop bar. The bar closes at 11. We went there at around 10:15 or so. Ordered one glass of red wine, one of white. About 10 minutes later, the waiter came back with a BOTTLE of red, and said he would be back with the white. Ok...so we waited. Since the bar closes at 11, at around 11:10 or so we left, and took the bottle with us. Around 11:30 the waiter appeared AT OUR DOOR!!! with the glass of white wine, although we had not told him the room number, and demanded payment for the bottle and the glass of wine. My BF doesnÂ´t even really LIKE red wine. I suppose we could have left it upstairs, but with noone there, someone else could have taken it. So I said, I donÂ´t even WANT the wine now. It had been almost an hour, and I was ready for bed. Long story short, we all went downstairs, to see the lobby staff, who were a little dismissive. Almost as if I was making the story up. But I couldnÂ´t have been, I was there, in my nightclothes, with the waiter, and the glass of wine. When I mentioned I would speak to the Manager, miraculously the wine was taken off the bill, and we were only charged for the glass of red wine. Oddly, i had to GIVE BACK the glass of white wine, which was fine, because I didnÂ´t want it, but for what??? To give to another customer when the bar was closed???? Just strange. So yes, I would recommend the hotel. Definitely. But BYOB.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: mambo28967
Reviews.Content: This hotel has to have one of the best locations in Sultanahmet (much better than I realised when I booked it!) Right between Ayasofia and the Blue Mosque, and 20 paces from the cafes and bars of Sultanahmet. It has amazing views across the Bosphorous from the roof terrace. Our room was ok - we had the room next to reception so we could hear the phone ringing, but that was the only downside to our whole experience. My sister was in the family room upstairs and she was over the moon with the 2 rooms plus ensuite that she had. The staff all spoke good English, and were all very helpful. Of the 3 hotels that we've stayed at in Istanbul, this is the only one that we would come back to. Breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best in location and price!”
Reviews.Author: NadiaMustafa
Reviews.Content: We were there for 4 nights and starting from the airport pickup till the time the luggage was loaded in our rental car 4 days later, everything was superb. The staff was very helpful and we even managed to rent a good cheap car at the same quality value as that of Avis, thanks to the Manager ,Kadir Kilic. Will definitely book this for my parents in Summer , 2012. Infact everyone we met in Istanbul was extremely helpful, even though not all could communicate in English. Superb hotel and amazing city!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Good Value.”
Reviews.Author: abdullexus
Reviews.Content: We were offered a double room in the basement, which we found was very comfortable, with heating you could control. The staff were very polite and helpful at all times. Abdul & Yasmin definetley plan to visit Istanbul again and stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location within walking distance to everything.”
Reviews.Author: D61andS57
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights. This lovley little hotel is close to all the major sites in the Sultanahmet district. The staff were pleasant, helpful and very knowledgable and accomodating. In particular, Serkan was always available to help. The view from the rooftop terrace is breathtaking in all directions. Rooms were clean and comfortable and the breakfast which is included was also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, unbeatable location..”
Reviews.Author: ReemaTh
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel after finding our booking cancelled at another hotel " it happened twice in Istanbul, be careful and check the status of ur internet booking before u go". Rooms were clean and the bathroom was ok, Small thu. Staff weren't friendly and don't speak English. the breakfast is basic. The superb thing about this hotel is the location, it's in the center of all the attractions in SultanAhmet area; around 3 minutes to the blue mosque and Aya sofia , seven minutes to topkapi.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Highlights”
Reviews.Author: Rapidsman
Reviews.Content: We found this place on Hotels.com and was very satisfied with our selection. It's just around the corner from most of the main tourist sights with a hundred restaurants with a few blocks. An upscale bazaar is just down the block. The manager was more than willing to help us find a bank with we had issues with an ATM machine. The room was twice as big as a hotel room we stayed in while in Stockholm and having come off a cruise ship the bathroom was larger than mine at home. They were able to arrange for a car to bring us to the airport in the middle of the night at a cheaper rate than the local "airport bus" and i was direct with just us. I would stay here again without giving it another thought. Just remember the "call to prayer" from the Blue Mosque at 5:45 am.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Views, Mostly Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Cobbikaze
Reviews.Content: We booked a room here for 3 nights on our trip to Istanbul. The hotel IS in a fantastic location - right down the block from the Four Seasons. At the edge of Sultanahmet. You easily walk to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Bascillica Cistern, etc. It is in a very quiet section (not many tourist walking around) on a lovely street. The roof-top terrace has amazing views of both the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sophia. Our room was a good size and the bathroom was also better than expected. Breakfast was included in our room and was pretty good. For the most part, the staff was very good. We did encounter one character who wanted to take us shopping, send us to a friends rug shop, etc. We did try to avoid him at all costs. Note that you are in Muslim city and you will probably hear the sunrise call to worship, you should expect that - and it's part of the reason we travel, to experience different cultures. Overall, the hotel is an excellent location to use as a base for exploring the fantastic city of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: rs49
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Armagrandi Spina in June 2011, on the recommendation of friends who had been there a month earlier. They had cautioned us about getting short-changed on the room. We had booked a â€œComfortâ€� room (a step up from the â€œ economyâ€�) but we found it to be extremely small - a small bed with a few feet of space around it. When we protested, we were given a larger room, much more comfortable - but this too was called a comfort room. I think they try and pass off the small rooms first, which are probably "economy" rooms. So, please insist on seeing the room first before you check in. Breakfast was included in the room rate. It was exactly the same every day (we stayed 5 days) and not too good. The rooms are clean, housekeeping is efficient, there is a TV, safe and a minibar. Free wi-fi is a great value addition. In spite of its drawbacks, if we ever go back to Istanbul, we would still stay at the Armagrandi Spina because of its excellent location. Walk out the back entrance and you find yourself with the magnificent Aya Sofiya on your left and the Blue Mosque on the right. Walk on and you are in the midst of Sultanahmet Square, a little further, Topkapi Palace. Just around the corner is Arasta Bazar; there are plenty of great restaurants close by. The metro stop is 5 minutes away and you can get to anywhere in Istanbul from there. No better place to stay for a tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a good place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: globaltravelcouple29
Reviews.Content: Hotel Spina is in such a convenient location, right in the midst of the Sultanahmet. You can walk everywhere in Istanbul from here and lots of good restaurants a stone throw away. The roof terrace has spectacular views of both the Blue Mosque and the Aya Sofya and the water all around. Rooms are spacious and well equipped. Breakfasts excellent, especially nice to sit outside. Staff friendly and helpful. The manager asked if there was anything about the room that needed attention - both small things we mentioned were sorted that day!! A great place to use as a base for a week in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly people”
Reviews.Author: Uli62166
Reviews.Content: The small team of the hotel was really great. Breakfast was good compared to other places of the same categorie. The room was not so convincing , it was clean but maintenance was not up to standard. The location is perfect if you want to explore Istanbul. Overall it was a good stay and we would come back on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: n0tat0urist
Reviews.Content: This a great hotel in a great location. The room had a good view of the Blue Mosque, was modern and very clean. 2 min walk from our room and we were standing at the fountain in between the Blue Mosque & Aya Sofya. There is a brilliant roof terrace with the best views of The Blue Mosque & great way to watch the sunset. It also has views of the Aya Sofya, the river & the Asian side. We were asked if we wanted to have a drink & were recommended a red wine, which was brought up to the terrace accompanied with fruit. We visited the terrace everyday and had it to ourselves. A good value hotel in the best location of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: olinka1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in July 2011 and have only positive feedback on it. Great location, close to all the action in Istanbul including the Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia and the Grand Bazaar and not far from the harbour. The staff were very friendly and helpful and were happy to meet all our needs and give advice as to the best places to visit in Istanbul. The rooms were airconditioned, had free wifi access, television and extremely clean. Overall a fantastic hotel and we would recommend it to anyone looking for a hasslefree and enjoyable time in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, euro problem”
Reviews.Author: Exeter_pride
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, won't forget the view for a long time. Strangely we had to pay for drinks in euros an always had change in euros, of which I'm sure the waitir cashed in a lot because of the exchange rates. Breakfast became monotonous after a week but a great location and nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Shrusam
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an excellent location in Sultanahmet for a reasonable price ($120) where all the sights (blue mosque, hagya sophia, topkapi palace & grand bazaar) and the sultanahmet tram station are very closeby. The hotel is pretty clean and the staff are friendly. However, the staff was not knowledgeable about the area and had trouble providing tips for food locations . They gave us the wrong directions when we looked for a turkish breakfast and could not give us location for a store to find a pin converter (they did not have one unfortunately). The terrace view is great and has a lovely view of the blue mosque and hagya sophya. The included breafast is a continental breakfast for the most part and do remember that they charge for the freshly squeezed orange juice.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for what it is”
Reviews.Author: Julue
Reviews.Content: The Armagrandi Spina capitalises on its great location and good rooms. The breakfast is absolutely mediocre and reminds to what one gets when one is paying 60 Euro per night rather than 120 Euro. I have stayed in other hotels in the area that were cheaper and offered much more, including tea, coffee throughout the day and had a lovely choice for breakfast. In the Armagrandi they serve you cheapest lemonade and bad coffee and make you pay extra for good coffee and fresh orange juice. This hotel leaves me with a bad taste of an enterprise geared towards tourists who only stay once and never come back. This may be also the reason why they don't even bother to ask for client satisfaction....

Reviews.Title: “In the Middle of It All”
Reviews.Author: NYCTexans
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite literally in the middle of the Blue Mosque and the Haggia Sofia. Just stepping out through the back door, taking a few steps , and you are there! We stayed at the beginning of our 2-week stay and again for the final 2 days but in a different room. The first one was on the 1st floor and comfortable. It had some upkeep issues (peeling wall paper, missing molding) but the second time there, our room on the 2nd floor was better maintained (minus the broken shower head holder and less than sparkling white sheets). The breakfast was very tasty, offering a variety of cheeses, pastries, olives, eggs, breads, yogurt, breads, cereal. For a small fee, you could get fresh squeezed orange juice, too. As you return to the hotel after a day of touring, you are offered tea, coffee, or wine. I suggest having this outside your hotel at it would probably be just as expensive but with better ambiance. The staff was very helpful and pleasant, especially Suleman. He was very friendly, showing us the terrace, the tram system, and offering easy conversation. I would recommend this property for its location and value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: shaodcp
Reviews.Content: Excellent Location!! Very close to Blue Mosque and other historical attraction. The managers, Kedir and Mustafa are very friendly and helpful. Very happy to have found the hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Old Style, Amazing Location, Small rooms!!”
Reviews.Author: El-Wigo
Reviews.Content: I visited Istanbul this November and I really enjoyed my stay in Spina Hotel, nothing but for its GREAT location, the hotel is located between the Blue Mosque, Ayasofia and Top Kapi. They have a backyard where you can have your morning coffee with a spectacular view of the Blue Mosque, the place is quite and peaceful. The things I didn't like is that the room was really small with a tiny bathroom, also the breakfast wasn't great. But again the location was a privilege. Go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, comfortable rooms, well equipted, enjoyable breadfast.”
Reviews.Author: WAGrayfox73
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, quiet street, easy walking to Blue Mosque . Haggia Sophia, and Topkapi Palace as well as very good restaurants. Breakfast variety very good. Staff most accommodating and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location - basic accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Savoya
Reviews.Content: A truly wonderful location in Istanbul. Literally a two minute walk to Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque. Situated in a lively (tourist) district of this great city, the noise from the street and surrounding bars can be a distraction for those who want to turn in early. But it's all about location, location, location! The staff is very friendly and helpful but sometimes unable to offer real help. When we mentioned that our toilet didn't flush and that we had no hot water we were assured a few hours later that the problem had been resolved. But no, it hadn't, the toilet never flushed (we used the dustbin provided in the bathroom and filled it up with water drawn from the bath) and the temperature of the water in the shower never got comfortably warm. Rooms need updating and bathroom needs refitting, urgently. The rooftop terrace is a real hidden gem with a 360Â° view over the city. Go up here at night to watch the sun set behind the Blue Mosque - it's exhilarating. All in all a good experience, but don't be disappointed by a few flaws.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, standard service”
Reviews.Author: EasyGlobetrotters
Reviews.Content: The perfect position at the very centre of the historical area makes this hotel a very good choice for a short vacation in Istanbul. (In any case, we strongly recommend to sleep in Sultanahamet if your main objective is visiting Istanbul historical sites) - Rooms are simple but clean and well furnished (frigobar, TV, a/c) - Friendly receptionist speaking fluent English - Internet connection available (1â‚¬ per hour) - Turkish breakfast (you won't find continental breakfast) - 1 minute walk from Blue Mosquee, Haghia Sophia and public transport - Good value for money

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: hotcurry62
Reviews.Content: We walked in, took a basic room (very comfortable) at a good price, had a great first night in Istanbul. The next morning I had a very rapid anaphylactic reaction to body wash I had used for the first time (my own) & needed urgent medical attention! The manager on duty got the nearest taxi (ambulance would have taken too long) to take us to the hospital, he came with us (in total shock as he'd not seen anyone in that situation before) & the 5km trip took 20minutes! The non english speaking staff at the hospital were at a loss as to what I was saying "I NEED adrenalin NOW", the manager called a friend on his mobile who translated for us to the doctor what I had to have, & consequently could very well have saved my life! He stayed with us for 3 hours & on arriving back at the hotel, upgraded us to the suite on the top floor & was an amazing comfort to us. All the staff were wonderful & friendly, (as everyone in Turkey is) & we would stay there again without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “This is not a 4 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Sandmama
Reviews.Content: The Good: This hotel is in a spectacular, central location. It's a five minute walk to the blue mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Hippodrome, Cistern etc. The hotel staff is friendly and helpful although I found myself slightly annoyed by one individual who would hover around waiting to be tipped for things like moving a suitcase 3 feet or bringing a spoon at breakfast. The hotel is clean enough, but the housekeeping staff is laconic at best about cleaning your room when you are in it. Hotel laundry is very reasonable at 10 turkish lira a kilo. The Bad: There is extremely loud music from one of the 'dervish shows' nightly until about 11pm. Its not just a bit of noise because it is so amplified that even with the windows closed, it can be heard very clearly. This is obviously not the fault of the hotel, however, I think it is something they really ought to mention. Especially when granting a booking to families with young children. We found the breakfast to be sort of gross including very runny scrambled eggs, hot dog slices in some kind of red sauce and cold french fries each morning. Stale bread was left in the bread basket, and fruits had obviously not been washed. Still, we all managed to find good things to eat like hard-boiled eggs, fresh rolls (if we got up early enough), and oranges. The Ugly: Our bathroom had been retrofitted with a 'spa tub' that leaked water onto the floor from underneath, each time we used the shower. We were afraid to even try the spa tub. Black mold was growing on the shower tile grout which could easily have been cleaned with a bit of bleach and water. The bathroom floor was vacuumed, but never washed during our stay. Linens were not changed until I stripped a bed and left the dirty linens on the floor. In summary: The state of the bathroom, lame housekeeping, stale bread at breakfast, and even the geraniums in our windowboxes, which were dying from lack of water, all told me that nobody in the hotel cares very much about the overall guest experience. There is an absolutely beautiful rooftop patio that the hotel barely uses, just too much effort to trudge up all those stairs, I guess. At over $250 a night, I would have liked to see some evidence of a little care. The Armagrandi Spina is a perfectly fine, but by no means, good, hotel.

Reviews.Title: “pretty little hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: WeavervilleQuince
Reviews.Content: Situated between the Blue Mosque and the Aya Sofya the Armagrandi is walking distance from many of the important sites in Istanbul. The hotel is pretty, cozy, clean and the service is very friendly. The breakfast is good and plentiful. Be sure to enjoy a drink on the rooftop terrace. There is a gorgeous view of the city and the Bosphorus. We stayed for four days and thought the hotel was a very good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: rishadnathani
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had initially booked in Mangana Konak Hotel (sister hotel and same management) and were disappointed with the location. We called the GM of the hotel and he put us in touch with Pinar (Armagrandi Spina) at the front desk. Pinar was really helpful and courteous and offered for us to stay at Amagrandi Spina instead. I do want to say that the rooms at Mangana Konak were really nice, only the location was not. Pinar sent us a taxi to bring us to her hotel at their cost. She showed us three different rooms on the 5th and 6th floor to choose from and we chose the room on the 6th floor overlooking the Blue Mosque. The elevator goes till the 5th floor and you have to walk one floor to reach the 6th. The room was large with a private balcony and floor to ceiling glass between the balcony and room allowing for a fantastic view. The room and bathroom were very clean and the air conditioning worked well. The bed was comfortable and linen was fresh. There was a little sitting area inside overlooking the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. The best part of this hotel is, firstly the location. The views, as mentioned above, are breathtaking and its only a couple of minutes walk to either of the monuments. Secondly, the staff is extremely courteous and friendly. As mentioned in a few other reviews, Pinar was a real star. She was extremely helpful and advised us correctly on every query of ours. Although a few reviews mentioned that the rooms were small we were given a really large, well appointed room with a private balcony!! Just above the room is a terrace which has truely the best views one can have from Sultanahmet. I will post a few photos in a couple of days to show what the room and the views are. Another person deserving mention was Cirken (don't know if i got the spelling right). He worked there as sort of a handy man, bringing us ice, glasses, food, sending our clothes for laundry and doing practically anything we asked for. He was really sweet and spoke basic broken English but could understand everything we asked. Breakfast was basic and disappointing. They have no menu/food, room service was limited to bringing us some breakfast in our room one day, glasses, ice buckets, a bottle of local wine, etc. Overall we were very happy we moved to this hotel. Ask for rooms on the 5th and 6th floor if you plan on going here as they have fantastic views especially our room on the 6th floor (it was the only room with a private balcony). Get your own bottle of wine, sit on the terrace during sunset and ask Cirken to bring you an ice bucket and glasses. Its the best view you of the city from up here.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and very good location”
Reviews.Author: chmV
Reviews.Content: Everything was fine. Good food for breakfast, prefect location, just 5 min to all Historical places, Aya Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Basilica Cistern... Only WiFi connection lost times to time and Internet speed not so fast.

Reviews.Title: “WELCOME TO ISTANBUL!”
Reviews.Author: IstanbulYildiz
Reviews.Content: Great lÄŸcatÄ±on. Had a wonderful tÄ±me explorÄ±ng all the local amenÄ±tÄ±es whÄ±ch were just steps away such as Sultanahmet Mosque and HagÄ±a SophÄ±a. and of course shoppÄ±ng Ä±s at every turn. Local transport such as the tramway just a few mÄ±nutes walk away. Staff at ths hotel are extremely frÄ±endly and go out of theÄ±r way to accomodate theÄ±r customers. Would hÄ±ghly recommend stayÄ±ng there. Istanbul fully deserves Ä±t's tÄ±tle as European cÄ±ty of culture. 2010

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: SpainCris
Reviews.Content: Hotel situated in a lovely, quiet street between the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia, perfect for travelers because you can walk to all major attractions. Rooms are very new and clean, and some of them directly overlooks the Blue Mosque. From the terrace you can see also the Bosphorus while you have breakfast. My experience in the hotel was very nice, excellent.

Reviews.Title: “a challenging stay”
Reviews.Author: cunhaval
Reviews.Content: we choose to stay at armagrandi hotel altough it had controversial reports. we found out they were all correct. we were a group of four who arrived late at night after a confirmation of our reservations one month before our arrival and a phone call directly to the hotel to confirm transfer from the airport the night before our arrival. nevertheless , when we arrived, there was no room for us. they 'offered "us an "up grade" at a room at a hotel from the same company close to the armagrandi hotel. we did't accepted the "offer" and after a big stress when even they honored a room to a family who arrived at the hotel after we did, they promissed to acomodate us at the two best rooms at the hotel the next day. the room that we were sent at the first night as a suposed "upgrade",was a good suite,although we were not interest in preparing our own food during our 10 day trip. the bathroom was nice, but the shower , when used , caused a big flood . we reported that to the armagrandi front desk and they told us that was an construction error, as it would solve the question. it is not an up grade ever. the apartments are at the botton of the hill , wich means they are far from the armagrandi itself,were breakfast is offered and far from the historical sites. they have no view and no front desk. it isjust an appartment bilding, only in istambul's old village. we found out that is a normal procedure of the hotel: overbook and offer the "up grade". we noticed that for some people it is good enough, but definetively is was not what the hotel offered at the moment of our reservations. if you are lucky enough to have your reservation honored, the location of the hotel couldn,t be better. the view is great and the best rooms of the hotel are good. but if you stay at the standard rooms, such as room 201, you will find one of the smallest rooms ever. the tv is old and the control is dirty. the bathroom is small and the toilet has a cheap plastic seat. we didn't even had glasses to use in the bathroom or to drink anything from the mini bar. all that for 190euros a night. we asked for the kitchen to save a bag with medicine and some olives and cheese we bought while they changed our rooms, and they were able to loose it all. so we came to the conclusion that all the reports we read before were right. the ones that hated the hotel, were the ones that were not blessed, while the ones who loved, didn't have to face any desapointment. we had both experiences, since we satyed at the hotel for a period of four days and another for two days in the same 10 day trip. we stayed at the good rooms and at the unspeakable ones. the maneger desapeared while we were there and complained about our situation. the front desk worker, mr mustafa tried his best to confort us during our stay. important to say that the hotel offered us our transfer for free to compensate our desapointement and took back the offer as soon as the sun rised. we were not there to bargain and tried hard not to ruin our mood during our trip , so we didn't mind, but we think that is important to make a remark of the attitude, because we never saw somethig so unbelievable. to end our impressions we find important to say that we were asked every single day os our stay to write a declaration that we had problens with overbooking and the hotel solved the problem. we told that our reservation company wrote us asking for our review and that we would report to them directly, and than we were told that the declaration was to justify the upgrade for the three first days to their boss. That was also unbilievable, but actually happened.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located in Sultan Ahmet within 5-10 mins. walk from The Blue mosque, Aya Sofia and Topkapi Palace.”
Reviews.Author: BibigulDoha
Reviews.Content: Extremely courteous and helpful staff and Front desk Manager Pinar was very helpful in guiding us in the right direction to the places of interest which were fortunately all within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: madjoanna
Reviews.Content: This hotel must be about the best location in Istanbul. For breakfast you sit on a terrace with close up views of both the Aghia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. Through the bar there's another terrace with views over the Bosphorous and on the roof a sitting area with 360deg views of the whole of Istanbul. Our room was pleasant and clean with shower, bath, toilet, hairdryer, fridge, safe, air con and a small balcony. The staff were excellent - keen to help and keen to practice their English. The young woman on reception was particularly helpful and her English was faultless. If you've ever thought of visiting Istanbul, go - and stay at the Hotel Spina.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel,Super position ,but?!!”
Reviews.Author: PollySwitzerland
Reviews.Content: On our arrival seemed to take a while before we were shown a room. Eventually we were shown one downstairs. The room was big ,brick walls,very small windows,very dark(windows on level with pavement!!).I refused the room ,and said it was likea dungeon! we were then told we could have a room in the sister hotel,quite a distance away. this we refused,and after a lot of complaining,finally got a room.the room was very small,small bathroom,but at least daylight ,so we accepted it. It was obvious the problem was overbooking.I also heard twice during our stay (4 days) people complaining about the same thing. It is a shame,as it has put me of going to that hotel again. as I said the room was ok.Cleaning of the room could have been better. Towels not replaced one day,and I dont think the floor(wood) was cleaned once during our stay. It is a shame ,as the hotel is in a good position,wonderful views from the breakfast terrace. blue mosque,aya sophia one side,bospherus the other. The staff at breakfast,the staff in reception,all well mannered,and friendly. If you want to travel around ,tram not far away,and very efficient. Only 1.50 lira. Boat trips all very good.Trip on the Bospherus 9 lira return.also trip to the Prince''s Islands 3 lira one way 1hr 50 min,very good value,and very interesting. Taxim square for shopping,also bazar(there you need your nerves!!!!) you have to bargain hard. Istanbul is a fascinating place ,and I would love to go again.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and poky. A disappointment”
Reviews.Author: nutellaLondon
Reviews.Content: Incidentally the Armagrandi Spina Hotel and the Spina Hotel appear to be one and the same. We had a small, poky room with very little storage(ie a small wardrobe with no drawers, for 2 people), a bathroom door that did not have a key and did not even shut and bedside lights that operated on only one switch. There wasn't even a chair to sit on in the room. Toilet roll issue was very mean and we had to ask for sufficient towels and extra coat hangers as we only found 3 in the small wardrobe.We had booked 2 double rooms on the same floor and were promised these in writing but when we arrived were given rooms on different floors. We were told there was a garden. This turned out to be a small empty square of concrete at the back of the hotel. The breakfasts were adequate but uninspiring and the coffee was virtually undrinkable. In short, the hotel was overpriced for what it was. Having said that. it was in a good location between Ayia Sophia and the Blue Mosque and the view from the upper roof terrace was splendid. There was a very nice young lady at reception who was kind and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel thanks to its staff”
Reviews.Author: IceCreamMoscow
Reviews.Content: Well... This time was the second my visit to Istanbul. That's why choosing the hotel i prefered first of all location. Hotel is located perfectly, just between St. Sophia and Blue Mosque, close to Topkapi Palace, Basilique Cistern and tram station. Breakfast is serving on the roof with amazing view at St. Sophia, Blue Mosque & Marmara sea. The choice of dishes & food itself are good, everybody can find what to eat. The rooms are different, middle size, but in generally are good enough. We booked two rooms & we were satisfied with both of them. In case if we had any problems in the rooms it was enough to call reception & asking for help. During my vacation there i had a birthday. The hotel management sent me flowers & fruit basket. I didn't expect that & it was really nice surprise :) At the end I want to thank the staff & personally Mr. Kadir Kilic, sales & marketing manager. He was really our Guardian angel. He helped us in any small details during our stay in Istanbul. We forgot our camera in hotel's car on the way to airport & Mr. Kadir Kilic contacted me by mail saying about that. Thanks to him my camera now on the way to home ;)

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: aqualondon
Reviews.Content: This is not a four star hotel. Clean but very basic (not even a kettle in the room), TV didn't work, dim lights, small bathroom, Loud aircon. Breakfast is limited - not good at all. Walls are thin as we weren't talking loudly and people in the next room could hear the noise. If looking for a basic hotel, with friendly staff and central location this is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but not amazing”
Reviews.Author: CardiffRuggerhugger
Reviews.Content: Difficult to sum this one up really; we had a bargain here at Â£300 for 4 nights for 2 people, and had read other reviews on here before booking. If you're only in Istanbul for a couple of days, then the location is perfect for the sights, the Tram isn't far away to get to the other side of town, and the rooms are clean, but basic. Breakfast was OK, the hotel was OK, but the staff really are helpful and friendly. If you're expecting a 4* standard - you'll be disappointed, it's basically a guest house and to be honest, if you've ever stayed in blackpool for a weekend you'll know what you're getting. With the benefit of hindsight I would have stayed on the other side of the Golden Horn away from Sultanahmet, as the bars and restaurants on this side of town are nowehere near as good. Once you've done the sights over here you spend more of your time on the other side, and that's where all the nightlife is as well, so of an evening the only option to get back here is a cab - at about Â£15 - Â£20. Getting over here in the day on a tram is dirt cheap, and then you're better off for nightlife back in Beyoglu. All said though, it was cheap and cheerful, (the free wifi was a very good extra though) and couldn't really fault it, I'm sure that it's much of a muchness for the area at the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Below Average”
Reviews.Author: archnemesis
Reviews.Content: The location is great, and the breakfasts are really good. The staff are a mixed bag - very nice barman, but reception staff very cold and only interested in recommending places that they have deals with. Room was ok, but was ground floor street side and was very noisy - especially at dawn call to prayer! Bath was one of those that didn't drain very well when having a shower, and the bath was not very well cleaned by staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff but definitely overpriced...and be careful to the new suites”
Reviews.Author: torakikiLondon
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a long week end in Istanbul, and we booked this hotel on line. Unfortunately the main hotel was fully booked but they proposed us some suites they said were available at the same price, in another hotel of the some company. We saw the suites from the websites and they looked all right, except the fact that the location was not exactly specified. I am sorry to say that we were a little bit disappointed when we arrived because the suite was quite generous but the position was horrible...the building was really less than ten minutes walking from the main Hotel, that is really near to the Blue Mosque, however the area was totally different, something like the favelas in Brazil I could say ( of course in a different scale ), with lots of rubbish in the streets, poor houses all around, and actually we did not feel very safe coming back late in the evening because the building was totally insulated and quite far from the other hotels. Actually it was not an hotel at all, but just a building with some small flats inside, used as suites. Of course the benefit was that it was very peaceful, and there was a great terrace at the top with a view on the Bosphoro, but honestly the cleaning was not really good, the furnitures quite old and we had to go everyday to the main hotel to have breakfast. They supplied a car service but actually it was not very confortable...The main hotel did not seem to be so much better in terms of style and cleaness, and the breakfast was quite disappointing, I would say with a good choice of food, but rather low quality, especially drinks...I have to say that the staff was very kind and friendly actually, and this was very good...I don't say is a bad hotel, however I think that its quality is not absolutely valuable as a 115 euros per night...I can definitely say that in London for the same money you have much better hotel and we expected much more!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but no way 4 star”
Reviews.Author: cheyneyNorfolkUK
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located for the old city of istanbul and the staff are very friendly and helpful (if rather inexperienced) but by no yardstick with which I am familiar is it a 4 star hotel; at best I would rate it 3 star. Rooms clean but very basic, generally shabby decor and extremely dim lighting. Breakfast very limited and not enough tables if inside. On two days (out of four) water only tepid in the morning; broken glass on floor in bathroom for four days despite advising reception. They also double book; a friend arriving separately was put in a nearby unfinished flat for their first night and discovered two other hotel guests in same position in the morning. As all were prepaid one assumes the hotel is getting double on the rooms?? I looked around and there are far better hotels for the same price nearby; only stay here if you get a really good deal

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, Great location!”
Reviews.Author: fugacious
Reviews.Content: Lovely small cosy hotel in a great spot near to both the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sophia; despite being very close to both these landmarks, the hotels location is extremely quite and peaceful. The Topkapi palace and tram station are also nearby. Our room was spacious and clean with excellent decor and the view from the rooftop terrace is absolutely stunning; there is also free wifi throughout the hotel. The staff spoke good english and were really helpful and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Experience, Great for a short break”
Reviews.Author: gulseny
Reviews.Content: Very clean, nicely decorated boutique hotel. I cannot understand the negative reviews, the staff are some of the friendly we've ever come across and if you have a problem (e.g. on one occasion a taxi driver the hotel called for us royally ripped us off, we told the receptionist and within about 10mins our money was refunded and the taxi driver fined) just tell the staff and they will do everything they can to solve it for you. shower was great,- good water pressure and temperature bathroom has new tiles and is very clean. duvet cover was not changed on our second day there but as soon as i asked them to do so they made no issue out of it and changed them immediately. breakfast served in top floor terrace- spectacular views. good selection in the buffet, fresh breads (if you turn up late and stuff is running out, again just ask them and they will accomodate!) cakes jam cold meats lots of cheeses etc ultimately this is a basic, boutique hotel with not many ammenities (please expect this for the price you pay), but provides you with a great base for exploring an amazing city due to it's location. you feel secure and safe, the staff are very accomodating and bend over backwards to ensure you have a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “fun in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: wtaylor8275
Reviews.Content: I must say i had a great time at a little hotel on a side street just right next to many Historical sites. The hotel was recommended to me from a friend of mine that lives in Istanbul, it's a small and personal place with amazing hospitality. my room was vary nice, clean and comfortable and no matter what request or question i had, the receptionist had the most knowledgeable response. Everyone has great English speaking skills, I had a great time and i will definitely visit again as well as suggest this hotel to some one who wants to be treated vary well.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Pleasant Stay at the Spina”
Reviews.Author: H-A_Cairo
Reviews.Content: I think the best word to describe the spina is â€œcozyâ€�. Staying there makes you feel like you are staying at home. Being a small hotel, it provides a very friendly environment between you, the staff, and the other guests, something one may never find at bigger hotels. I stayed there with my family for five nights. We had two double rooms with a very good rate that included airport transfer. Everything was great starting with the reservation emails that I have exchanged with the owner, who was kind enough to meet every single request that I have mentioned. The staff was very kind, friendly, and hospitable. They always meet you with a big smile. There also wasnâ€™t a time when I was around any of the staff members and they didnâ€™t offer me something to drink (on the house). The rooms were nice and clean. The bathrooms as well. The WiFi in rooms was fast and reliable. To be honest, I was a little bit concerned when I was booking the hotel over the internet. I took a look at the pictures and the reviews and there were ones that concerned me. You always find people in reviews saying that hotels were not as good as they looked in the pictures posted on booking websites. I think with the spina itâ€™s quite the other way around. For me, the hotel was much better than it looked in the pictures and than how I expected it would be. I didnâ€™t find any of the problems either that people stated in their reviews. I was also thinking when I was their â€œwhy didnâ€™t these people request help from the staff if they had any problemsâ€�. Whenever I requested anything from the staff, they were on it right away. Also if the request requires sometime to be fulfilled and you forget about it and get caught up in the touristy stuff, the staff never forget. One of my family members got sick and needed medicine. They got me the right medicine and gave me intake directions in less than 10 minutes, and sparred me the hassle of looking for a drug store. And I cannot begin to describe how perfect the location is. It is within a walking distance from most of the touristic attractions and also very close to the sultanahmet tram station that takes you to Taksim (city center) and other shopping places. The view from the roof terrace, where breakfast is served, is also the best view ever with ayasofya on one side, the blue mosque on the other, and asian side in the back. I also think that the hotel is great for all ages and groups. So being a group of friends, a family, or a couple, spina just works for all. If I am ever in Istanbul again I will definitely choose to stay at the spina. I am also very happy now that next time I will not have to go through the hassle of searching for the right hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Base for Exploring Old Istanbul- Hotel Armagrandi Spina”
Reviews.Author: gfs53
Reviews.Content: We are happy to tell anyone that our stay was thoroughly delightful, rooms and furnishings are generous and very comfortable, and the helpfulness of the staff greatly enhanced the enjoyment of our stay. The convenience of the hotelâ€™s location is truly remarkable, being a short and enjoyable walk to several of the worldâ€™s most historic sites: the Blue Mosque, (the hotelâ€™s rooftop dining terrace is the best view of that amazing building), Topkapi, Aya Sofya, the delightful Arasta Bazaar and many other treasures of this cityâ€™s remarkable history. Although the hotelâ€™s street is quiet, a short walk leads to the tram stop at Sultanahmet with only a few minutesâ€™ ride to the numerous ferries connecting to points all along the Bosporus shore, the Golden Horn, and to Asian Istanbul, or across the Galata Bridge to modern European Istanbul. The hotelâ€™s quick access to the improved highway leading to the airport makes it much more convenient than many other locations in the city. We look forward to returning to the Hotel Armagrandi Spina and Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: kkbelle
Reviews.Content: Hotel Spina is a superb and quiet location right beside Ayasofia and the Blue Mosque. I can not imagine how others here have said it is noisy, as apart from the inevitable and 5 times daily Mosque call to prayer, the place is lovely and quiet. My room 302 had double glazed windows not a stones throw from the Blue Mosque, and city noise to me (a city dweller) was minimal. I had trouble with the retractor on a suitcase and the staff could not have been more helpful if they tried, dashed about with various tools to fix the handle. The breakfast room is a treat, on the rooftop of the hotel and it is equipped with a rare thing indeed in Turkey - a TOASTER...so we had a Sultanahmet view and tea and toast and strawberry jam - luxury. WIFI is in all rooms and it is fast and reliable. I would say it is 3 star accommodation with 4 star attitude, and worth a visit if you are looking for budget accommodation in this range.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: forbes12
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Spina for 11 nights. The boutique hotel has one of the best locations in Istanbul, the roof top terrace has perfect views between the blue mosque and the Hagia Sofia. The area is not too busy and away from the back packers world a few block down but remains within 5 mins of the blue mosque. The hotel was clean and provided a personal service. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. we will definitely stay here again on our next trip to Istanbul !

Reviews.Title: “Rip off!!!”
Reviews.Author: goldenflute
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 4 day stay at the Spina Hotel and wouldn't reccommend it. I've stayed in lots of budget hotels so that really wasn't the problem. As with another reviewer during our stay the water was suddenly switched off in the morning mid-way through a shower. On speaking to reception I was told that the water would be back on in '1 minute' but 1 hour later it still wasn't. The hotel manager was sullen to the point of being rude. Breakfast was just appalling and we ended up having it at local cafes for the duration of oue stay. Breakfast is from 8 to 10.30am. We arrived at 9.30am and all the eggs had run out and were told that they would not be making anymore!!! The tea and coffee were also in short supply and there was no milk we waited for 15 mins after asking about 5 times for milk for our cereal. I had to make an emegency phone call to the UK. There were no phone rates displayed in our room and i was really horrified to be presented with a bill by the hotel of 26 euros for a 4 min call - that was over Â£6 per minute!!!The only good thing about the hotel was its location.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Buckeye96
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nothing special. On the plus side, the Spina hotel has a great location only 5 minutes away from the Blue mosque and the Aya Sofia. Breakfast is pretty good with nice views from the terrace and there is free Wi-Fi. However, the room where my wife and I stayed was small and run-down looking. The air conditioning was on full blast the entire time but the room never really cooled down. The minibar fridge didn't work so the drinks were never cold and the little TV in our room only had 3 English channels 1 of which is CNN International...boring. If you are looking for a place to crash at night with a nice location, the Spina hotel is alright. if you are looking for luxury, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “noisey and uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: maya4ever
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a perfect location a few metres from the Blue mosque but the beds were very hard and uncomfortable, the rooms were not cleaned out at all,apart from the beds being done. Due to this area being a popular tourist area it was quiet noisey til about mid-night and early morning again, the first day we go there having been up since 3am in the mornign to try and get some sleep at 11pm was impossible due to the noise and the hotel being in the heart of the tourist spot! The price we paid was a bit off a rip off but the staff are very friendly and the hotel is local to the site seeings!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, in a great city”
Reviews.Author: really_razamataz
Reviews.Content: There are clearly a number of people who have not enjoyed their stay in the Spina, but we stayed there for 3 nights with barely any issues. I booked Executive Suite 404 at the hotel after spending a lot of time on this site and general googling to try and find a really great suite for my wife and I to have a break from the children. I only booked three weeks ahead so many places were already full but the Spina did have a suitable room and were reasonably quick in answering my email request. On the confirmation email they only had me down for 2 nights so I called them and they (after a bit of persuasion) had the reservations manager confirm the booking was for 3 nights (even though the it was late in the evening when I called from the UK and he had left the hotel). All my other email communications were answered politely and without problems. They collected us from the hotel (even though our flight was delayed) and took us to a very clean and well sized room. The bed was enormous (we are both over 6ft but this bed was at least 6ft wide as well!). After chucking the suitcases on the bed we went straight out and found the locality still welcoming at 11pm but with no real noise audible in the room. The Arasta bazaar is 1 minute away with a large coffee house still open at that time. In a parallel street there were restaurants and bars. As others have said, there is a fantastic roof top view of the Blue Mosque and the Aya Sofia. Absolutely fantastic. The sites themselves are no more than 3 minutes slow walk away. The tram stop is 5 minutes away. If you don't mind walking, the whole of Sultanahmet is literally on your doorstep but without the noise of being on the main streets. The suite 404 is one flight of steps from the rooftop restaurant but we only used it for breakfast which was certainly a big spread (2 types of cereal, breads/pastries, cold meats, cheese, jams, fruit and yoghurt, eggs both boiled and scrambled, together with fruit juice etc). Service was immediate and on each day they rearranged the tables to make sure we could be outside and yet in the shade. They always cleared the plates quickly and carried our drinks where they could. On every occasion where we had need to speak to the staff, they were polite, with excellent English, and attentive. The hotel was clean, and modern. It certainly looked like it was well cared for. The only slight quibble might be that the aircon could have been colder (it only runs when you are physically present in the room - but they had a good sized mini-bar that had space to chill water we bought locally). We would certainly stay there again. The hotel was close enough to the sights to let you go back to the hotel for a snooze between walking sessions. I thought I paid a fair price for the room and that the little touches (like fruit to welcome you) showed they did care about customer service.

Reviews.Title: “A Big Rip Off”
Reviews.Author: nelsoli
Reviews.Content: The only redeeming factors for this hotel were its location (right next to the Blue Mosque and the Aya Sophia) and its rooftop garden (one of the higher ones in the area), the hotel was a big rip off and lacked any sort of customer service. I was travelling with a male colleague and accordingly, we reserved two rooms. However, upon our arrival, the hotel indicated there was only one room available for that evening. While my colleague and I are friends, it was a little bit awkward. You don't necessarily want people from work seeing you in your pajamas. The front desk promised us transportation to the airport to make us for the mishap. The next morning, while I was in the midst of shampooing my hair, the water was turned off, literally. Half an hour later, there was a trickle of water that came out of the pipes but not even enough to power the shower. So I had to bend off and cup my hands to accumlate enough water to wash myself clean. Upon advising the hotel manager of this problem and asking for a discount, he indicated he was already giving us a discount by only charging us for one room and not two as was indicated in our reservation. I patiently explained that he was not giving me a discount and he only gave us one room. While he did not agree with me, after two minutes, he finally gave in and agreed to take 40 euro off the price of the room for one night. The day before we were meant to check out, we attempted to reserve the hotel car for a ride back to the airport. The hotel manager explained that he had discounted the room by 40 euro and that the ride to the aiport would not be free. I tried to explain that the 40 euro discount was for the inconvenience of not being able to shower and that we were still owed something for the mishap in the one room/two room situation. He said there was nothing he could do. OWe immediately checked out, walked 50 meters outside the hotel, and found a great room at the Side Pensyon for almost half the cost. Overall, Hotel Spina was a big rip off and I would never return.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: macpwv
Reviews.Content: This location was perfect for 2 women traveling alone who wanted to spend their money elsewhere. The desk clerks spoke clear english are were most helpful with dinner reservations. The small tour buses were able to access the road and pick us up at the front door. This is how great the location was; we were within walking distance to the following-1 block from the Four Seasons Hotel; 1/2 bl from the Blue House(nice for an after dinner drink); 6 minutes to the tram- Balikci Sabahattin(phenomenal restaurant); 1 minute to the Blue Mosque, Sophia Haggis, Underground Cistern. At breakfast we looked out at the Blue Mosque and beautiful tulips planted in the center of the city. We were very comfortable walking around this area at night. There were slight inconveniences in changing rooms but the upside was that one night they moved us to a very nice suite. Request your rooms on the Blue Mosque side as there was a lot of noise (cat noise) on the front side.

Reviews.Title: “Be Careful”
Reviews.Author: TruthInAdvertising
Reviews.Content: We paid 75 Euro for a double by using a local travel agent (rack rate is 119 Euro). We expected a decent room, but nothing too fancy. The room we received was really small, as was the bed (a true double). There were no options for upgrading on the first night and no way to cancel (no cancellations after 11:00am), so we asked to upgrade the second night. The hotel staff said they could not provide a price for the upgrade until the following afternoon (after the 11:00 cancelation time). The uppgrade price was severe, so we were faced with choosing between another night in substandard accomodations or paying the price. We took the upgrade, but did not feel good about the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, charming hosts”
Reviews.Author: moehrm
Reviews.Content: With a group of 6 people we stayed at Spina Hotel for 4 nights. The location is great, rooms very clean and comfortable, but above all is the service provided by the staff! They made our stay very memorable in the best sense of the word. We can recommend this hotel without reservation. Our next stay in Instanbul will certainly be at the Spina Hotel. M. Moehr

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: mystical18
Reviews.Content: Wonderful manager, wonderful hotel. Stunning location. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Spina is the best!”
Reviews.Author: caltraveler21
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my third time in Istanbul. Each time I have stayed at the Spina Hotel, and each time I continually to be amazed! It literally has everything...location (between the San Sofia and Blue Mosque), incredible views (roof top dining and drinking afford amazing views), fantastic staff (always incredibly friendly and always willing to make your stay better), and great rooms (very nice rooms with great bathrooms and great views). All in all, a fanastic place to go. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Never ever again”
Reviews.Author: sftor73
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was absolutely horrible. We arrived at the hotel to find that they had our reservation but did not have room. That the hotel was over booked and moved us to their "sister" hotel called Diva's. The hotel according to them was 200 meters away... not even close. Was more than 1km at least and in another part of the Sultanhamet. When we had told them we did not want to move the manager then came out and told us that this was because of sewer problems... which was clearly a lie given that this excuse was a new one and that the original receptionist told us they were over booked. We ended up moving hotels to the new one 1km away since it was a weekend and most of the hotels we checked with were at this point full. When we arrived at Diva's we found several other guests who had all also been moved.... it appeared nobody actually stayed at this hotel becuase they booked it. The room at the hotel itself was adequte except the air conditioning was virtually non-existent and very hot. Overall we were very very disappointed with this hotel and their service.

HotelInfo.Name: Armagrandi Spina Istanbul
HotelInfo.Address: Utangac Sok. 19 | Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34400, Turkey
